description: Dive into "Romantic Rhythms of Rhodes Town" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Romantic Rhythms of Rhodes Town

places.generalDescription: Nestled at the pinnacle of the historic Street of the Knights, the Palace of the Grand Master of the Knights of Rhodes stands as a magnificent testament to medieval architecture and history. Originally constructed by the Knights Hospitaller in the early 14th century, this imposing fortress was built atop an earlier Byzantine stronghold from the 7th century. Once serving as both a grand residence and administrative hub for these valiant knights, it has witnessed centuries of change.

sources.snippet: Essentially an occupying army, the Knights of St John transformed the northern segment of the Old Town during the 14th and 15th centuries, to create what‚Ä¶
sources.shortName: attractions Rhodes Town, Rhodes

sources.snippet: The Palace of the Grand Master perched on top of Street of the Knights is a gigantic stronghold with a triple circuit of walls defending it sitting in Old Town‚Äôs highest point. This was erected on the location of the older Byzantine fortress (7th century AD) and was constructed by Knights Hospitaller or Knights of St. John (at the beginning of the 14th century), the Catholic military order that was the ruler of island from years 1309 to 1522. Situated on the square plan that centers on a massive internal courtyard, the building fell into bad shape after the knights departed.
sources.shortName: Rhodes Town - Travel Guide/Best Places to Visit in Rhodes

sources.snippet: A must-see attraction in Rhodes is the Palace of the Grand Master of the Knights, a 14th-century marvel located in the heart of the Old Town. Here, couples can explore the beautifully preserved castle and admire its intricate architecture. Another highlight includes indulging in a relaxing boat tour, where you can enjoy the breathtaking beauty of the surrounding waters and discover hidden corners of the island.
sources.shortName: The Best Things to Do in Rhodes for Couples: Top Experiences to Cherish Together

sources.snippet: Standing imperiously in the heart of the Old Town, this 14th-century palace is a must-see when you explore the capital. Built by the Knights of St. John, the palace was a Medieval residence for island governors and a holiday home for Mussolini.
sources.shortName: 51 Fun & Unusual Things to do in Rhodes, Greece

sources.snippet: The Palace of the Grand Master ‚Äì it was originally a Byzantine fortress which later housed the administrative center of the Order of Knights. Nowadays the ground floor holds two large exhibits about the city of Rhodes.
sources.shortName: Wandering around the Old Town of Rhodes, Greece

places.name: Palace of the Grand Master of the Knights of Rhodes

reviews.text: Tickets are 20 EUR, but honestly, it's worth it, the palace is stunning, with beautifully preserved halls, mosaics and a real sense of history. The inner courtyard is impressive, and walking through the massive stone corridors feels like stepping back in time. Try to visit early in the day to avoid crowds and the heat. It's one of the must-see landmarks in Rhodes Old Town.

Plenty of fascinating history to explore, with what appears to be original decor or faithful reproductions. However, the ‚Ç¨20 entry fee felt a bit steep for what was on offer and didn't quite deliver value for money. The experience could be improved with more interactive elements to better engage visitors. Still, it's worth a visit if you're a history buff or interested in medieval architecture.

This place is so neat!  Tickets are 20Euro or about $23 USD.  Get there as early as you can, it gets crowded fast.  Amazing restored rooms and furniture and so much to learn and see.  It is an impressive building and beautifully decorated.  There is a wonderful museum at the end to view as well.

places.generalDescription: Lindos Acropolis is an ancient citadel located on a steep cliff with stunning sea views. It offers a glimpse into prehistoric sites such as the nearby Acropolis of Lindos and Rhodes, along with ancient Minoan artifacts dating back over 3,000 years. Nature lovers can explore the Valley of Butterflies and enjoy miles of sunny beaches.

sources.snippet: Nestled on a hilltop overlooking the picturesque village of Lindos, the Acropolis of Lindos is another captivating site for history-loving couples. This ancient archaeological site dates back to the 4th century BC and offers a diverse array of monuments to explore, including a temple dedicated to Athena Lindia, a Hellenistic stoa, and the remains of a Roman temple.
sources.shortName: The Best Things to Do in Rhodes for Couples: Top Experiences to Cherish Together

sources.snippet: Then head to Lindos and stroll around the best archaeological site in Rhodes. The natural setting overlooking the sea from a precarious cliffside position just makes it even more dramatic.
sources.shortName: 51 Fun & Unusual Things to do in Rhodes, Greece

places.name: Lindos Acropolis

reviews.text:
Lindos Acropolis is a must-visit when on Rhodes. The combination of ancient ruins, dramatic cliffs and panoramic sea views is unforgettable. Tickets are 20 euros per adult and it's smart to buy them in advance to skip the line, we waited around 15 minutes. Along the way there are QR codes you can scan to buy tickets online, but if you're already close to the entrance, it might be quicker to just wait in line.
The path up is steep and not secured with handrails, so be careful, especially with kids. Wear good shoes and bring a hat or cap, as it gets very hot during the day. Once at the top, you're rewarded with stunning views over Lindos Bay and the white town below.
The site has some restored areas and informational signs. Go early if you want to avoid the crowds and the heat. A mix of history, nature and views that truly makes it one of the island's highlights. Worth every step.

The view and scenery were simply stunning!ü§©the only complain comes from the route to the temple, it is quite difficult as the terrain was hard to walk and no safety rails whatsoever exists, lots of other people going. Anyway, I'd recommend this as one-time visit if above points are not blockersüëçüèºtickets 20‚Ç¨/person at the gates

Walking at a decent pace you can get to the top in about 10 minutes. Stunning views and some wonderful history to be seen. Do some reading before you go as there isn't much explanation up there - also you can find tickets online significantly cheaper than paying at the entrance.

places.generalDescription: The Holy Monastery of the Virgin Mary Tsambika (Kyra Psili) is a small Byzantine-era monastery located on a hill overlooking the sea. It houses the church with the miraculous icon of the Virgin Mary, known as Panagia Tsambika, making it a significant religious site for childless women who often leave baby dolls as offerings. The monastery also offers stunning panoramic views over the northern part of Rhodes and requires climbing around 300 steps to reach it.

sources.snippet: One of the best romantic thing that you can do in Rhodes is to set sail on a private yacht with a captain or you can rent your own boat and just explore the coastline. You will get to enjoy mesmerizing views of the towns and mountains ranges of Rhodes while you relax in the sun with your partner close by. This is a peaceful escape that you and your partner deserve.
sources.shortName: Romantic things to do in Rhodes

sources.snippet: Tsambika Monastery is another place you should visit in Rhodes. The Monastery is, in fact, a really small Byzantine church built on top of the mountain. You have to climb more than 300 steps to get there!
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Rhodes | Attractions + Tips

sources.snippet: Key places we recommend visiting include Lindos Town, the beaches of the south east, Monastery Tsambika and the hidden coves of St Pauls and Anthony Quinn.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to do in Rhodes for Couples

places.name: Holy Monastery of the Virgin Mary Tsambika (Kyra Psili)

reviews.text:
The Holy Monastery of the Virgin Mary offers an absolutely stunning view over Tsambika Beach - truly breathtaking and totally worth the effort.

Getting to the top, though, is no joke! There are around 300 steps, and with the heat, it became quite a challenge. We had to stop for breaks several times, so make sure to bring water, wear proper shoes, and avoid the hottest part of the day if you can.

The monastery itself is small but peaceful and charming, with a serene atmosphere. There's a respectful dress code so remember to cover-up just in case.

Even though the hike is tough, the view from the top makes it 100% worth it - perfect for taking photos and enjoying a quiet moment above the beach.

highly recommend visiting this peaceful and sacred place. It is very beautiful, calm, and magical. Here you can write your family's names and wishes in the book, offer a prayer, and feel a deep sense of peace in your heart. It is a truly spiritual experience. Recommend go there on sunset time, around 7pm.

View worth to climbe about 300 steps in 30 degrees. It's not so hot because path goes through forest so many shades and mountain breeze refreshing. Take water is highly recommend.

It takes around one hour to climb up and go down (from parking where steps starts).

places.generalDescription: Kallithea Springs, located by the seaside, is a historic spa with Art Deco architecture and a beautiful beach. Dating back to the 7th century B.C., it has been a popular destination for those seeking the therapeutic benefits of its thermal waters. The site also features the Rotunda, where visitors can relax and enjoy Greek cold coffee, as well as opportunities for snorkeling in the clear waters.

sources.snippet: The healing properties of the thermal waters at  Kallithea Springs have been known about since ancient times. Go for a swim or soak in the thermal waters before making use of the other facilities here, including a caf√© and a diving school. Entry to the Kallithea Springs costs ‚Ç¨4.
sources.shortName: Things to do in Rhodes: The Ultimate Guide

sources.snippet: Marvel at the majestic Moorish buildings of Kallithea Springs as you wander around this famous complex. The therapeutic healing properties of the water here once attracted patients from far and wide, and today you too can tap into the tranquillity of this restored spa.
sources.shortName: 51 Fun & Unusual Things to do in Rhodes, Greece

sources.snippet: Surrender to the therapeutic ambiance of Kallithea Springs, where crystal-clear waters invite you into a rejuvenating experience. The romantic setting, adorned with arches and gardens, offers the perfect backdrop for relaxation and connection.
sources.shortName: Live the romance of your life in Rhodes: 6 couples‚Äô experiences you shouldn't miss

sources.snippet: You‚Äôre spending a few days in Rhodes, and you want to relax a bit?. Then, you should definitely go to Kallithea Springs!. The Springs are located East of the island, 9 km away from Rhodes City.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Rhodes | Attractions + Tips

places.name: Kallithea Springs

reviews.text:
Gorgeous place, we visited Kallithea Springs in June and really enjoyed our stay. The place is absolutely gorgeous, with stunning architecture that feels both historic and elegant. The small museum adds a nice cultural touch, and the on-site restaurant is lovely with great food and views.

The beach club was a highlight, so relaxing, with crystal-clear waters and the unique experience of swimming where natural spring water meets the sea. A perfect mix of history, beauty, and relaxation. Highly recommended!

Great spot for swimming and grabbing a drink, with a 3‚Ç¨ entrance fee, but sunbeds are pricey, starting at 50‚Ç¨. The atmosphere is lively, and the water is crystal clear, making it an ideal location for a day of relaxation. The bar offers a variety of refreshing cocktails and snacks, perfect for enjoying under the sun. While the sunbeds may be on the expensive side, the experience of lounging by the water makes it worth the splurge. Families and friends often gather here, adding to the cheerful vibe of the place. If you're looking for a fun day out, this spot is definitely worth considering.

Basically this is a small inlet on the coast with some interesting architecture, pleasant gardens and plenty of sun beds for hire.

Initial ‚Ç¨5 entry fee just gains access to the site. If you just want to wander around for an hour that's all you need.

Deck chairs, sun beds or kabanas are extra, ranging from ‚Ç¨20 to ‚Ç¨120. I felt this could have been clearer on the website. There's a couple of bars. The prices were a little premium but not too bad.

If you like movie history you can find the shooting locations for several movies on the site.

Despite reading the website and going there in person I'm still not sure where the spring actually springs from!

places.generalDescription: Lindos Beach is a popular destination located in a cove with a long stretch of sandy shoreline, perfect for swimming, sunbathing, and boating. It competes for attention with the ancient Acropolis of Lindos standing above it and the charming whitewashed houses cascading down the hillside. The beach offers fluffy yellow sand and clear waters ideal for families due to its shallow depth. Visitors can enjoy amenities such as bathrooms, showers, changing facilities, and sun loungers.

sources.snippet: As the sun sets and the sky turns golden, Lindos Beach becomes a beautiful place for couples to have a romantic getaway. The soft sounds of the waves against the beach make a great background for relaxing walks at sunset. Lindos Beach has beautiful sand and great views, making it a peaceful place for newlyweds to spend time together and think about the start of their marriage.
sources.shortName: Honeymoon in Rhodes - Top Romantic Ideas for Couples

places.name: Lindos Beach

reviews.text:
This sandy gem tucked in a small bay offers stunning views-especially with the ancient Acropolis towering above. The scenery is pure magic!

For just ‚Ç¨20, you get two sunbeds and a parasol (a fair price for the location). Clean showers are conveniently placed around the bay, and there's no shortage of great restaurants and shops nearby for snacks or full meals.

Ideal for sunbathing, swimming, or just soaking up the dreamy Greek vibes. A must-visit in Rhodes! ‚≠êÔ∏è

Overcrowded, no free zone, expensive umbrellas, tons of boats everywhere. Actually clean water if you never go out of it. Would not return. Probably better to visit by boat so you don't go near the beach. Sad thing is I'd rate it 5* if I came off season, probably.

Really nice beaches I would advise to hire a boat out for 2 to 3 hours

More of a discount if you take it out more hours give you an opportunity to enjoy some snorkelling around different bases my experience this is better than actually going on a tour packed boat with other people . Plus the kids get to build their confidence jumping in and out of the sea and also experiencing driving about.

places.generalDescription: Rhodes, a Dodecanese island in Greece, is renowned for its rich cultural and archaeological sites, as well as its sandy beaches and vibrant nightlife. Despite being a popular tourist destination, there are tranquil spots beyond the bustling areas. The island's history is deeply rooted, blending medieval and traditional Greek influences. Its natural beauty is evident in the picturesque beaches facing pine-covered mountainsides and charming seaside towns.

sources.snippet: If you want to enjoy a great day on a boat during your stay in Rhodes, here is my selection of the best boat trips. You just have to click on the orange links to access all the details and make your reservation. As these excursions are very popular, it‚Äôs very important that you book in advance!
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Rhodes | Attractions + Tips

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre hoping for a romantic holiday, you‚Äôll need a beautiful backdrop. All Greek islands are gorgeous, and although it‚Äôs not really a competition, we believe Rhodes is especially picturesque. You just need to look through a few photographs of our island to see what we mean.
sources.siteName: Rhodes Experience | Private Tours & Sightseeing in Rhodes
sources.shortName: Is Rhodes the Best Greek Island for Couples

places.name: Rhodes

reviews.text: The Old Town and tip of the peninsula is where all the amazing sites and history are, incredible place.
Rhodes is such a beautiful city. Would definitely recommend visiting!
Beautiful island, near Turkey coast, very Green northern island. Stunning water. Amazing old Town, full of life.

places.generalDescription: The Archaeological Museum of Rhodes, located in the Old Town, is housed in the Medieval building of the hospital of the knights. It showcases ancient artifacts and art from excavations all over the island and small islets of Dodecanese. The collection includes figurines, vases, tomb groups, small objects from Ancient Ialyssos and Kameiros dating from Geometric to Roman times.

sources.shortName: attractions Rhodes Town, Rhodes

sources.snippet: This museum is found inside a building in the Old Town that was previously the hospital of the Knights of St John. The contents of this fascinating building are just as interesting, with a whole host of objects discovered in Rhodes that date back to Roman and Hellenistic periods. The Archaeological Museum of Rhodes is open daily from 08:00 to 20:00.
sources.shortName: Things to do in Rhodes: The Ultimate Guide

sources.snippet: Release your inner Indiana Jones and go exploring in this fascinating archaeological museum. Housed in a medieval building inside the Palace of the Grand Master, this is one of the top places to visit in Rhodes Old Town.
sources.shortName: 51 Fun & Unusual Things to do in Rhodes, Greece

sources.snippet: The Archeological Museum of Rhodes ‚Äì the best museum in the Dodecanese that holds finds from the island, including relics, urns and marble statues dating back to ancient times.
sources.shortName: Wandering around the Old Town of Rhodes, Greece
Rhodes Town: Photos, Map, See & Do

places.name: Archaeological Museum of Rhodes

reviews.text: Absolutely amazing! The first floor rooms are stuffed with beautiful ancient artefacts, then through the church area into rooms full of statues. Don't miss going outside into the garden area - enormous mosaics are displayed in a special area with ponds and citrus trees. I spent hours in here - after 3pm I pretty much had it all to myself.

An absolute must visit I'm so serious. you enter somewhere rather empty and once you step into the real museum section it's like it comes to life, there's SO much theres literally corners just filled with pillars and such because I can only assume they have so many that they don't know what to do with them?? üò≠ History from all throughout the ages in a building that reflects that, it's honestly all just beautiful I was awestruck. I could've been there all day I think. ‚Ç¨10 for adults and free for under 18s (maybe 21??) and moree than worth the price. Genuinely really miss it, wish I was there now.

Quick warning however!! There are some rather uneven stairs with no handrails so if this is something you might struggle with I wouldn't say not to visit but I'd definitely say to be prepared for it. Not to call him out but my grandad stumbled on them and definitely could've hurt himself rather badly, we were lucky he was alright. Could happen to anyone, take care with those stairs

An enormous collection housed in a beautiful structure, the Museum is a must see! A carefully curated history of Rhodes in antiquity, there are hundreds of artefacts to admire. Allow plenty of time but be aware some galleries do not permit photography! Other exhibitions are not open on a Tuesday.

There are some idyllic little gardens to admire too along the way, and the structure itself is beautiful. Highly recommended, just allow plenty of time!

places.generalDescription: Butterflies Valley, located on the Greek island of Rhodes, is a 600-acre nature park that serves as a summer home for numerous butterflies. The valley is particularly popular from late May to late September when thousands of Jersey tiger moths gather in the shaded canyon, which boasts the only natural forest of Oriental Sweetgum trees in Europe. Visitors can explore walking trails and benches while being surrounded by formidable walls and medieval buildings in the nearby Old Town of Rhodes.

sources.snippet: A winged spectacle awaits you every year in Rhodes from June to September. Millions of vibrant, colorful Panaxia butterflies (species ‚ÄúPanaxia quadripunctaria‚Äù) can be spotted on tree trunks to feed on the juices of the Zitia tree and lay their eggs. The Valley of Butterflies is a charming and serene place, filled with magnificent natural beauty, bridges, paved walks, ponds, tiny waterfalls, a tranquil atmosphere, and an unforgettable experience for all visitors.
sources.shortName: Live the romance of your life in Rhodes: 6 couples‚Äô experiences you shouldn't miss

sources.snippet: Discover a beautiful hike through Butterfly Valley, perfect for nature lovers. Hidden in a quiet part of Rhodes, this lovely valley is a home to many different plants and animals, especially in the summer when a rare species of butterflies comes to live there. The walking path goes through a lot of green plants and trees, where you can see beautiful waterfalls and colorful flowers and hear the peaceful sounds of nature.
sources.shortName: Honeymoon in Rhodes - Top Romantic Ideas for Couples

sources.snippet: Surround yourself with thousands of dancing butterflies in this lush natural reserve in western Rhodes. Come between Spring and Fall to witness dazzling clouds of color performing astonishing aerial acrobatics right before your eyes.
sources.shortName: 51 Fun & Unusual Things to do in Rhodes, Greece

places.name: Butterflies Valley

reviews.text:
üåüüåüüåüüåüüåü
Magical Butterfly Valley ‚Äì A Hidden Natural Wonder in Rhodes

Visiting Butterfly Valley (Petaloudes) in Rhodes is like stepping into a living fairytale. Nestled in a lush, shaded gorge, this enchanting place is home to millions of butterflies during the summer months - a truly mesmerizing sight as they flutter among the trees, especially the beautiful Jersey tiger moths with their striking orange underwings.

The valley itself is a cool, peaceful escape from the heat, filled with winding paths, wooden bridges, waterfalls, and streams. The atmosphere is serene, with the sound of running water and rustling leaves accompanying you along the way. It's a nature lover's paradise and one of the most unique experiences on the island.

BUT - be prepared! The walk is no joke. You'll be heading uphill and downhill quite a bit, so make sure to wear good sneakers and bring plenty of water, especially on hot days. There are lots of stairs and uneven terrain, but the effort is absolutely worth it for the views, the butterflies, and the overall experience.

Whether you're into nature, photography, or just looking to enjoy something different and peaceful, Butterfly Valley is a must-visit. It's not just a tourist attraction - it's a natural wonder that leaves you in awe.

Tip: Go early in the day to avoid the crowds and catch the butterflies while they're most active.

When it comes to nature on Rhodes, this is indeed an interesting valley. The trail consists of two stages: you walk through a gorge among trees and shrubs, along a stream, with the occasional small waterfall or pond. Wooden footbridges, benches to rest on, and the occasional butterfly create a pleasant atmosphere.
However, the path goes uphill, with plenty of stone steps, so in 40¬∞C heat (we had 49¬∞C that day ‚Äì we wanted to cool down) this activity is not for everyone. At the beginning, in the middle, and at the end of the trail, there are toilet facilities (they cost ‚Ç¨0.50 ‚Äì a bit of a pity that it's not free when you eat in the restaurant or in the park), restaurants, and rest areas. We had a coffee, and it was okay.
In August 2025, the entrance fee is ‚Ç¨6. You walk uphill in a crowd, on a stone path, and ‚Äúadmire‚Äù the charms of the valley. In my opinion, those charms are rather average. The price is adequate for the attraction. Worth a visit, but it's not on the TOP list for Rhodes.

The Valley of the Butterflies is a hidden gem in Rhodes ‚Äì peaceful, unique, and absolutely worth a visit. Walking through the shaded paths surrounded by lush greenery and waterfalls feels like stepping into another world. During the summer months, thousands of butterflies gather here, creating a magical atmosphere that's hard to describe in words.

Take your time to enjoy the calm, listen to the sound of water and nature, and if you can, climb up to the monastery at the top for a beautiful panoramic view. Wear comfortable shoes ‚Äì it's a gentle hike but with some steps ‚Äì and bring your camera, because every corner is a picture waiting to happen.

A place where nature shows its most delicate side. Truly unforgettable!

places.generalDescription: Tsambika Beach is a popular destination on the island of Rhodes, offering a long stretch of golden sand between rocky headlands. The calm and shallow waters make it ideal for families to swim and play. The beach is well-organized with supporting facilities such as restaurants, sunbeds, and water sports centers. Accessible by public transport, this family-friendly outing provides opportunities for swimming, sunbathing, and enjoying refreshments from small snack bars.

sources.snippet: Tsambika Beach is a stunning stretch of golden sand on the eastern coast of Rhodes. It is an ideal spot for couples to relax and enjoy the clear blue waters and warm sunshine. There are sunbeds and umbrellas available for rent, making it easy to spend an entire day at the beach.
sources.shortName: The Best Things to Do in Rhodes for Couples: Top Experiences to Cherish Together
8 Unique Things To Do Beyond The Beach

places.name: Tsambika Beach

reviews.text:
This in one of many beautiful beaches in Rhodes. So many to choose from. But tsambika beach is all sand!!
And parking very easy.
Nice clear shallow water for little ones and older ones like my daddy.
We parked literally a stones throw from loungers( which are only ‚Ç¨20 for 2 loungers and umbrella. Food and drink was also good value. Servers are there to take payment of loungers and food. Now if you drive you drive down long winding road, from main road tho beach must be a good mile walk, in heat, no joke!
But if you drive , there is lots of parking. Watch out for potholes at bottom and drive slow. I suggest take a right at bottom of hill.
Lovely sandy beach.

Absolutely loved it! We had the best experience and a wonderful time here. The beach is spacious, clean, and perfect for families with children. The water is calm and shallow near the shore, making it safe for kids to play. There are plenty of sunbeds, shaded areas, and good spots for snacks or drinks. Highly recommended if you're looking for a relaxing and family-friendly beach in Rhodes!

One of the best beaches in Rhodes! üåä The sea is crystal clear, the sand is soft and golden, and the atmosphere is perfect for relaxation. Highly recommend visiting and enjoying this beautiful spot - clean blue waters and a stunning sandy beach üèñÔ∏è

places.generalDescription: Marco Polo Restaurant is a popular dining spot located within the Marco Polo Mansion hotel, housed in a historic Venetian-era building. Since its opening in 2008, it has been consistently fully booked due to its efficient kitchen and service, as well as the warm hospitality of the owner. The menu features dishes such as seafood salad, oven-baked sea bream with traditional Greek fisherman's soup sauce, and grilled tagliata.

sources.snippet: Marco Polo Caf√© is situated in the Marco Polo Mansion, a lavish hotel in the heart of the old Turkish Quarter of Rhodes Town. The building itself dates back to the 15th century when the Ottoman Empire was in its prime. The Mansion aims to bring that historic era back to life, as its interior ...
sources.shortName: Best 19 Restaurants in Rhodes, Greece

sources.snippet: For an upscale evening meal in Rhodes Old Town, this restaurant in the old Marco Polo mansion is the place to go. Sit among the vibrant flowers in the enchanting courtyard to enjoy the exquisite cuisine and intimate setting. Marco Polo Caf√© is open daily from 19:00 to 23:00.
sources.shortName: Things to do in Rhodes: The Ultimate Guide

places.name: Marco Polo Restaurant

reviews.text:
Poked away in an unassuming side street, this place is well worth the find. Right from walking in, the staff matched our energy and gave us a smile and a laugh - then absolutely delivered with accommodating us despite it being a busy night.

Service was fast, personable, professional - but fun.

And then the food: thoroughly delicious. It was so good my pal has gone and attempted to reproduce it himself. I'm sure whatever you pick, you will be absolutely delighted.

Shout out to the manager/supervisor and everyone else that made the night memorable for us. Sorry we didn't end up making it to the boat party....! üòÖ

Good service and a pleasant atmosphere, typical of the Old Town of Rhodes. You need to have a reservation in advance. The presentation of the food is very good but the portions are small and the prices are high. The beef we ordered medium came overcooked and dry, but on the other hand, the fish was pleasantly juicy with a crispy coating.

The food here was very very good. The atmosphere is great. But the staff left a lot to be desired. We were not able to make a reservation less than 24 hours before because it was booked but we made on for the end of our trip. At first everything was nice, but by dessert it was clear we were not a priority for the staff and they had changed servers once or twice on us. We were offered a dessert special but it wasn't available. When we changed our dessert we ordered wine with it and nothing ever came and no one checked on us, while all the other tables have regular service and waiters who are talking to and engaging with them. After 20 minutes we got up and paid, still our server never checked on us. We were having a wonderful evening and it crashed really hard at the end.

places.generalDescription: Ostria Beach Bar is a popular spot located in Kalathos, just 6 km from Lindos on the coast of Rhodes. It offers a perfect blend of beach relaxation, vibrant nightlife, and delicious cocktails. The bar hosts regular performances by musicians and DJs from across Europe, creating an exciting atmosphere for visitors. With its lovely quiet beach, affordable beach beds and umbrellas, and friendly staff, Ostria Beach Bar provides a tranquil escape away from the crowded tourist spots.

sources.snippet: Philosophia Beach Taverna (Pefkos) ‚Äì Philosophia features in our romantic restaurant recommendations and we just had to include it again. If you‚Äôre in Pefkos and have alternative dinner plans for the evening, stop by Philophia Taverna for sunset cocktails and a light snack. Its panoramic beach views make it one of the best sunset spots; and their cocktail menu is very good!
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to do in Rhodes for Couples

places.name: Ostria Beach Bar

reviews.text:
Away from the heavily packed tourist locations - was recommended by a local. Other places charge ‚Ç¨20-30 for a bed, here is ‚Ç¨5!!

The feeling of being on a deserted beach is fantastic here. Calm and tranquil beach with some fantastic food at the beach bar.

Staff are fantastic here too. A must visit - would come back to Rhodes just to relax here.

Fantastic atmosphere, great cocktails and a super chilled vibe. The best for miles around in my opinion. Cleanliness is a 5/5 and attention to detail is 10/10. Would highly recommend. A day at the beach, an evening in the restaurant or a
Pit stop, it has it all. The staff are all friendly and very helpful.

Bar at the beach. Big parking space. Moderate prices. Nice food. Wonderful, young, smiling people works here. Smooth music.

Beach - probably many better looking beaches around. But this one is quiet, huge and clean. Mix of sand and pebble. Water is warm.

We are staying 7 days in Rhodes, and wanted to visit many sites and beaches. This one is only one we visited twice, even it is ~40 km away from our hotel.

places.generalDescription: Kallithea Beach is a picturesque destination located on the East Coast of Rhodes Island. The beach features a long stretch of sand and fine pebbles, backed by pine trees and crystal-clear waters perfect for snorkeling. Visitors can also explore the nearby Kallithea Springs, known for its art deco architecture and pebble mosaics. This family-friendly beach offers sunbeds for hire and various water activities, making it an ideal spot for both relaxation and adventure.

sources.snippet: Starting with the long stretch of sand and fine pebbles at Kallithea Beach (with a shore trip to the Kallithea Springs, where you‚Äôll enjoy the art deco feel and pebble mosaics). Move on to the green-and-blue-watered Anthony Quinn Beach (so-called because the American actor fell in love with the bay during the filming of the Guns of Navarone). And, finally, visit the pure fine sand of Tsambika and Agathi.
sources.shortName: 8 Unique Things To Do Beyond The Beach

sources.snippet: Rhodes has a choice of popular, family beaches, or more isolated sandy spots for those who wish to get away from it all. Whether soaking up the sun on the white sand or heading out into the water, it is easy to find the perfect beach for you.
sources.shortName: Top Things For Romantic Couples & Honeymooners To Do In Rhodes

places.name: Kallithea Beach

reviews.text: Beautiful calm beach. We paid ‚Ç¨30 for 2 sun loungers with umbrella on the front row and ‚Ç¨25 for the second row. We arrived at around 10am at there were plenty available. Nice little restaurant on the beach that will bring you food n drinks and a couple of shops that have beach essentials.

A great beach ONLY when you dont have to pay,
On certain day you need to pay to acces the beach and it is quite pricy so i would recommande not going there on friday and satturday but instead go there on tuesday it was free for us there was no one.
The beach itself is Nice its quite calm exept when you have to pay theres a lot of loud music.
There are beach banch which are free with free sun umberela.
The beach itself is quite good looking not a lot of litter.
So to conclude its a great beach on free days

Having explored numerous beaches in Rhodes, I can confidently say this one stands out as my absolute favorite. In fact, despite our limited number of days on the island, we ended up visiting twice. Sunbed prices vary depending on their location; on our last day, we chose a cabana-style sunbed with covered sides and top for ‚Ç¨25 per person. Both the service and quality exceeded our expectations.
The restaurant offerings were exceptional. From breakfast to cocktails, every item was prepared with care, featuring balanced flavors and fresh ingredients. The staff were attentive, frequently checking in to ensure we were enjoying our time.
The sea was crystal clear, and snorkeling around the rocks to observe various fish added an entirely new dimension to our day. With its pristine waters, comfort, and high-quality service, this beach delivers outstanding value

places.generalDescription: Farma of Rhodes is a captivating petting zoo boasting over 100 friendly animals, including deers, camels, donkeys, lemurs, and ostriches. Visitors can interact with the animals through feeding and petting experiences while capturing memorable selfies. Notably, Farma of Rhodes is the exclusive location in Rhodes where playful Lemurs can be found and interacted with.

sources.snippet: Discover the beauty and excitement of Farma of Rhodes, located just a few meters away from the Valley of Butterflies. This attraction is one of the most popular on the island, offering visitors an up-close experience with various animal species. Here, people can get up close and personal with animals such as ostriches, camels, donkeys, deer, kangaroos, wild boars, ponies, llamas, and sheep by feeding, petting, and taking pictures with them.
sources.shortName: Live the romance of your life in Rhodes: 6 couples‚Äô experiences you shouldn't miss

sources.snippet: Get hands-on at the Farma of Rhodes, where a menagerie of unusual inhabitants is waiting to greet you. Have a go at feeding the ostriches and kangaroos or try taking a selfie with a llama. Fancy hanging out with the camels?.
sources.shortName: 51 Fun & Unusual Things to do in Rhodes, Greece

places.name: Farma of Rhodes | Petting Zoo

reviews.text:
What a wonderful farm! We thoroughly enjoyed our visit. We typically like visiting farms and zoos, but we believe this one was the best. The staff are great and very friendly, and the animals appear happy. You're permitted to interact with many kinds of animals, including raccoons and lemurs, as well as feed ostriches.

The farm itself is well-maintained and easy to navigate. There's a restaurant, and in the second section of the farm, you'll find a small kiosk and a playground for the kids. The staff at the raccoon enclosure were excellent, and the ladies with the ostriches were very friendly and patient. We particularly recommend the lady (we've forgotten her name) at the lemur enclosure; she was incredibly professional and very encouraging with our three-year-old, who did wonderfully there. This is a must-visit place!

Such an amazing experience! We had so much fun. It's wonderful to see that all the animals are safe, happy, cared for, and so loved by the staff. ü©∑ We also had the rare opportunity to feed and play with the lemurs-something very few people get to do. I highly recommend it! You can't visit Rhodes without going to the Farma, or you'll miss out on a truly unique and wonderful experience! ‚≠êÔ∏è

I would recommend Farma Of Rhodes to anyone visiting. It's is such a special and beautiful place to visit as a couple or a family. You can see the care the staff give to the animals and how much this place means to them.

We visited a year ago and had to come back as it was a highlight of our holiday. The guides at each point are helpful and so knowledgeable however the lady who is the keeper in the lemur enclosure is just amazing. Her passion and love for the lemurs shine through and her knowledge is exceptional. She is an absolute credit to the farm.

The lemur experience is one I would tell everyone to do and is not one to be missed. My kids love it each time we have visited and always reflect back as one of their best times in rhodes.

There is also a lovely cafe with amazing milkshakes that the kids raved about. An amazing day out and one I would recommend over and over again. We will be back

places.generalDescription: Situated in Megalou Alexandrou Square, this coffee shop is known for its charming atmosphere. Housed in a historic knights lodge built during the 1500s, it boasts an inner courtyard with a century-old tree at its center. Visitors can enjoy excellent coffee, homemade pastries, desserts, and light meals. Diners have the opportunity to indulge in their meal surrounded by medieval architecture within the peaceful courtyard.

sources.shortName: Best 19 Restaurants in Rhodes, Greece

places.name: Auvergne Cafe Bar Restaurant

reviews.text:
We stopped in for some tea one afternoon, and kept on coming back because it was such a nice place, and the tea was great. So were a couple of glasses of wine one night - which were accompanied by an unexpected gift of olive tapenade on bread.

We didn't eat here, but what others were having looked good.

The atmosphere makes this place. The courtyard is lovely and incredibly peaceful. Great for a break between exploring the old town. Unfortunately 1 meal (veggie pizza) from our food order didn't arrive which was disappointing and 1 of us didn't end up eating. The staff were friendly but a bit forgetful. They were super attentive to take your order but then once you're ordered and sat down they were often difficult to get hold of. Ended up scrapping the pizza after the long wait and was removed from our bill. Maybe just a bad day. Shame, but nice venue.

We found this place by chance while walking around in  Old Town of Rhodes. Very nice and cozy atmosphere, with a huge tree that provides a lot of shade and a nice breeze. Varied and tasty veggie options (better than most restaurants that we've tried in the island), good options for non-vegetarians too. Well made drinks. I would definitely come back and recommend it. Nice staff.

places.generalDescription: Philosophia Beach Restaurant is a popular spot for those seeking a delightful dining experience with a stunning beach view. The restaurant offers a modern twist on traditional Greek dishes, beautifully presented alongside an array of cocktails. Guests can enjoy the impressive lunch menu in the shaded garden during the day. It's recommended to book early for the best tables, especially for sunset views. The seafood is particularly exceptional, being freshly caught and served promptly.

sources.snippet: Philosophia Beach Taverna (Pefkos) ‚Äì One of our favourite restaurants in Rhodes is Philosophia Beach Taverna, located in the south-east village of Pefkos. This outdoor eatery is perched on top of the cliffside, overlooking the fine beaches and yachts below. Ask for a seat near the balcony and enjoy a romantic sunset and light sea breeze whilst gazing into your partners eyes.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to do in Rhodes for Couples

places.name: Philosophia Beach Restaurant

reviews.text: We saved this restaurant for our last night - and we were absolutely right to do so. The views of the beach were beautiful, creating the perfect setting for a truly memorable evening. The food was outstanding from start to finish, and the service was warm and attentive. A fantastic way to end our trip - highly recommended!

Stunning views and delicious food. Good sized portions too! We arrived without a reservation and the staff were so accommodating and made a table up for us. Service was excellent. We were staying in Lindos but took bus to Pefkos for the first time and thrilled that we did as this place is a gem, happy memories made - thank you!

Can't recommend this enough now I only have a few days left in Pefkos! Please don't spoil this hidden gem by rushing all at once!

The best view for a sunset going and the food is just what it needs to be, fantastic!

I always order the grilled Manouri cheese with figs and walnuts! You can thank me later if you order this amazing salad!

We visited at 3pm in June on a Thursday this time and had our pick of the tables!

places.generalDescription: Viewpoint Anthony Quinn Bay offers breathtaking views of the surrounding bays, including Ladiko Beach and Faliraki Beach. The road to access it is steep and narrow, making it a bit challenging for drivers, but the stunning vistas make it worth the effort. It's recommended to visit early in the morning or before sunset due to high temperatures during the day.

sources.snippet: Sail to the stunning bays of Kallithea or Anthony Quinn on a private yacht, and enjoy the clear water and beautiful views. Sail on the blue sea, find secret beaches, and go snorkeling, making special memories away from busy daily life. An absolutely special getaway for couples during their honeymoon in Rhodes island!
sources.shortName: Honeymoon in Rhodes - Top Romantic Ideas for Couples

sources.snippet: Anthony Quinn Bay, nestled on the eastern side of Rhodes, is named after the famous actor who fell in love with this picturesque location during the filming of ‚ÄòThe Guns of Navarone‚Äô. This small yet enchanting bay is characterised by its crystal-clear waters, vibrant sea life and unique rock formations.
sources.shortName: The Best Things to Do in Rhodes for Couples: Top Experiences to Cherish Together

sources.snippet: Glide through the emerald waters of Anthony Quinn Bay and spend a leisurely day relaxing at the beach. This is the best place to go snorkeling in Rhodes, so strap on your gear and dive below the surface to discover a marine world filled with mystery and majesty.
sources.shortName: 51 Fun & Unusual Things to do in Rhodes, Greece

sources.snippet: Move on to the green-and-blue-watered Anthony Quinn Beach (so-called because the American actor fell in love with the bay during the filming of the Guns of Navarone). And, finally, visit the pure fine sand of Tsambika and Agathi.
sources.shortName: 8 Unique Things To Do Beyond The Beach

sources.snippet: Take a sailing trip to some of the most beautiful and secluded beaches, like Kallithea and Anthony Quinn Bay. For those couples with an adventurous streak, all popular watersports are available on the island.
sources.shortName: Top Things For Romantic Couples & Honeymooners To Do In Rhodes

sources.snippet: Key places we recommend visiting include Lindos Town, the beaches of the south east, Monastery Tsambika and the hidden coves of St Pauls and Anthony Quinn.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to do in Rhodes for Couples

places.name: Anthony Quinn Bay viewpoint

reviews.text: Magnificent view and great area. It would have been possible to drive all the way up, but we chickened out and parked halfway. The hike up was demanding in the 37C heat, but it was all worth it.

Must visited spot. Driving is a little hard specially if you don't have a good car. You can stop in many parking spots on the way up and continue hiking not so difficult. Anyhow must seen and don't miss it

Perfect for family of x2 adults and x2 teens. We found a parking space after midday and made ourselves a space on the beach. If you are driving, search ratjer for Ladiko Bay which is the same  thing. Yes, it's busy but not over crowded. The water is magical. We snorkelled over to Anthony Quinn Bay which is better suited for adults only as it's rocky and not suitable for paddling. There is a ladder to get into the water. Many day cruise boats stop here for a quick snorkelling/swimming break.  There is a bar at Ladiko Bay but this time we had taken our own. Most people use water shoes. Considering how windy it was in Faliraki,  the Bay was quite sheltered.

places.generalDescription: Drosoulites is a charming tavern in Rhodes Town that pays homage to the ghostly legend of the Cretan rebellion times in 1828. This small plates restaurant offers a wide variety of traditional Cretan dishes, complemented by options like raki, tsipouro, and ouzo.

sources.snippet: Drosoulites is a cozy tavern with a characteristic Cretan ambiance. Tables are set inside and around an imposing, reddish, neoclassical mansion, with Cretan music playing all day long. The name refers to a ghostly legend, that dates back to the Cretan rebellion times in 1828.
sources.shortName: Best 19 Restaurants in Rhodes, Greece

places.name: Drosoulites - Rakadiko

reviews.text: Recommend the lamb leg with rice cooked in the oven. All food was great. At lunch time we were alone in the whole restaurant, so most probably there are more people for dining. The waiter wasn't the nicest one taking into account we were alone.

A chance to sample some authentic Cretan cuisine, some of which is quite different to the usual Greek fare.
Fab surroundings and hosted by an efficient and extremely friendly MC, this culinary adventure is highly recommended if you're anywhere near Rhodes Town.
Very nice place with beautiful grounds. Good service and friendly staff. Traditional Cretan cuisine and modern Greek cuisine. We really enjoyed the food and the quality of the dishes.

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the medieval part of Rhodes Town, Zacosta Villa Hotel is a charming and slightly old-fashioned three-room hotel offering a luxurious stay. The restored building is adorned with hand-picked furniture and features cozy rooms and suites. Guests can enjoy the lovely courtyard, wine bar with regular tastings, and excellent breakfasts. The hotel's location provides easy access to museums, the Knight's castle, and various dining options.

sources.snippet: Beautifully styled rooms blend the building's original features with contemporary art and simple modern furniture. There's a lovely courtyard terrace and delicious breakfasts. Great value, romantic, and walking distance to the beach.
sources.shortName: Best places to stay in Rhodes, Greece

places.name: Zacosta Villa Hotel

reviews.text:
Well what can I say! What a fantastic boutique hotel in a quiet part of the old town. It may be small but the rooms are big, very well cleaned (daily) with all the amenities you need. The aircon is a godsend given the heat whilst we stayed. Mr John and Nikos went out of their way to help with some lovely personal touches like collecting us from the town gates in a golf cart! The breakfast was lovely with plenty of coffee and it's taken in the courtyard.
Overall one of the very best hotels I've stayed at, 10/10 I heartily recommend staying.

I do not always give 5 stars but our experience has been so wonderful and memorable that we fell in love with this place!

Where to start?  Zacosta Villa Hotel is inside the medieval city (Old Town) which is an experience in itself!  The place is very cozy, well maintained, charming, and for a family of four with a 14 year ild and 12 year old, the room we got was perfect and has plenty of space!  The hotel has the historic look but with modern touches.  The room we got has a balcony as well which was a bonus.  The interior is a bit modern and has some nice touches to it.  There is a capsule coffee machine and they provide you with good coffee in capsules.  I love it!  They also provide bottled water and the replenish it daily.    There is a bar area at the property, although we did not get a chance to really use it but John the owner, told us that we can just grab
what we want and just pay for it the next day if we come back late and decide we wanted to drink.  We did have shots of Ouzo as their nice farewell toast for us!  They serve breakfast every morning.  It is a simple selection but it was good enough for us to be fueled to start our day really good.

The location is perfect!  Everything is within walking distance!  It is a short walk to restaurants and shops.  We just walked within the walls and because it feels like you went back in time and we loved everything we saw. we did not even feel we walked many steps each day.

What gave it a 5 stars are the people!  John (owner), his side kick, Nikkos who is now a friend, and the pleasant lady (I forgot her name) who always smiled as she set up and prepare the breakfast each day and also cleaned the room made our experience wonderful and memorable.  John provided us some great recommendations for places to dine and he was just so welcoming and very hospitable.  Nilkos helped us with everything we needed including a last minute car rental and we were able to try Ouzo for the first
time, which we loved.   We will mot look for any other place when we return to Rhodes, and we certainly will return!

Awesome! Nikos and John were fantastic hosts. Breakfast was really nice, the rooms are really cool, and the location could not be beat!  Being picked up with the golf cart was a particular hit with the kids.

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Lindos village, Lindos Comfy Suites is a delightful rustic-chic guesthouse that perfectly blends comfort with stunning sea views. Just a short stroll from both Lindos Beach and the iconic Acropolis, this charming retreat offers guests an inviting atmosphere filled with traditional white-washed architecture and vibrant local culture. Enjoy your mornings on private balconies or terraces while soaking in breathtaking vistas.

sources.snippet: This newly-renovated hotel sits opposite the Acropolis of Lindos in the heart of Rhodes. Interiors are airy, bright and minimalist, with a breezy palette of grey and white broken up by wooden beams and pretty wall sketches. Head to the hotel's roof terrace for romantic sunset views.
sources.shortName: Best places to stay in Rhodes, Greece

places.name: Lindos Comfy Suites

reviews.text: My girlfriend took me here as a surprise for my birthday.  The suites were nice and clean with a contemporary finish, while keeping the characteristic of the famous white buildings which Greece is known for.  Each suite is unique, which adds a more personal feel to your stay. The rooftop terrace overlooks the city and offers you great views and scenery.  The location is a 5 minute walk from restaurants and bars and 10-15 from the beach. Acropolis is roughly a 10 minute walk away and is a must if you visit Lindos.  Demetrius was very helpful and gave us complimentary drinks as it was my Birthday.  He was on hand to assist with anything we needed and gave us recommendations of where to dine and the best places to experience authentic Greek cuisine.   Overall it was an amazing vacation and the best birthday present.  I would recommend 5/5.  And look forward to returning.

This place is a dream! Very easy access by car from the main road, and once you park you will do everything by foot. We took the breakfast option, it was delicious and fresh. The staff was so hospitable and loving and made us feel like family and VIPs (thank you to Tamna and Eleni, and the sweet man who cooked us omlettes). The view from the hotel, breakfast/bar area is breathtaking. Everything we needed was in the room and we enjoyed ourselves so much!

I have stayed in many hotels on greek islands, but without a doubt this was the best one. We stayed in a Maisonette with balcony and had an amazing view. The room was just perfect, as was everything else. As mid May was still quiet, the breakfast was served instead of a buffet form. It was amazing! The atmosphere on the roof top terrace was great. The employees are extremely friendly and helpful.
Also you can park just on top of the hotel, right at the street, which is a big plus for Lindos. It's a short descend to the city center on foot.
I cannot wait to stay here again. Thank you for making our stay so special!

places.address: ŒïœÄŒ±œÅœáŒπŒ±Œ∫ŒÆ ŒüŒ¥œåœÇ ŒõŒ¨œÅŒ¥ŒøœÖ ŒõŒØŒΩŒ¥ŒøœÖ, Lindos 851 07, Greece

places.generalDescription: St. Paul's Bay is a picturesque area with historical significance, featuring megalithic ruins and an aquarium. The famous bay offers stunning views of the Aegean Sea and the coastline from its hilltop. The remains of a medieval fortified citadel and the ancient temple to Athena Lindia can still be seen, showcasing its great historical importance. The Acropolis of Lindos, overlooking St.

sources.snippet: Key places we recommend visiting include Lindos Town, the beaches of the south east, Monastery Tsambika and the hidden coves of St Pauls and Anthony Quinn.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to do in Rhodes for Couples
Top Things For Romantic Couples & Honeymooners To Do In Rhodes
8 Unique Things To Do Beyond The Beach

places.name: St Paul's Bay

reviews.text: The best beach around. It is PARADISE. Whatever you think of it is. Picturesque, tranquil and amazing. Highly recommend visiting. Get there early during peak season. Also there are 2 parts of St Paul's bay and there both amazing, so maybe visit one beach on one day and the other on another day.

I'll start at the end - the place only got four stars because of the exorbitant prices for loungers instead. EUR 50 for a pair of sunbeds and ‚Ç¨70 for a pair of covered beds. Theft. Beyond that the beach is very beautiful, pleasant atmosphere. We came with a snorkel which is nice, but nothing more. The water is transparent to some extent, but not something you can enjoy with a snorkel. There is an attached restaurant on the beach. The WC in the restaurant are free, don't pay for the paid WC.

Beautiful beach with great views, but can get crowded.
St. Paul's Bay offers gorgeous views and you can find free parking near the stadium, which is a few minutes walk.
For 50 euros you get 2 sunbeds and a parasol in July.

places.generalDescription: The Medieval Town Moat in Rhodes is a picturesque area with small alleys and traditional buildings. The main road, known as the Street of Knights, runs through this charming town. The moat itself is a deep ditch that surrounds the medieval city, historically serving as a line of defense for the town. Walking within these walls offers visitors a glimpse into the rich history and architecture of this ancient place.

sources.snippet: Commanding the highest point in the Old Town, this sturdy clocktower offers a tremendous panorama. Dating originally from the 7th century, it was damaged‚Ä¶
sources.shortName: attractions Rhodes Town, Rhodes

sources.snippet: Step back in time as you wander through the cobbled streets of Rhodes‚Äô medieval town, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The Palace of the Grand Master of the Knights is a testament to the island‚Äôs rich history. Marvel at medieval architecture, explore the grand chambers and soak in the romantic ambiance of this timeless masterpiece.
sources.shortName: Live the romance of your life in Rhodes: 6 couples‚Äô experiences you shouldn't miss

sources.snippet: The Medieval Town and the Port are excellent spots for relaxing. Take some good pictures, the landscape helps a lot. Also discover the small treasures in the gift shops.
sources.shortName: Rhodes Town: Photos, Map, See & Do

places.name: Medieval Town Moat

reviews.text: Beautiful walk through the green, lush moat of the old town. It's a long walk going all the way around with few points to get in or out. We came here around 4 o'clock and crossed about five people in total. Very quiet. Really cool to see the history of this place up close
Must do in Rhodes for a free, accessible peaceful nature walk along the magnificent castle walls. Meadows and old trees, birds, secret tunnels‚Ä¶ great spot for a picnic

A wonderful walk and great way to see the town walls.

Also good for gheko spotting.

Nice trees too

places.generalDescription: The Dreams Cocktail Bar is a great place to enjoy a drink and some Greek music. It has a great view of the town and the bar staff are very friendly. The cocktails are perfect and the atmosphere is really special.

sources.snippet: Ostria Beach Bar (Kalathos) ‚Äì Located on the quiet and well-maintained beach of Kalathos, this trendy, open front beach bar is the perfect place to see the unset from the shore edge.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to do in Rhodes for Couples

places.name: DREAMS COCKTAIL BAR

reviews.text: What's the best thing to do when it's hot at night and you need to chill down, have a drink .  We had spoken to the guy at the door there night before not sure if he was there owner but we told him we'll be over tomorrow night as we had other plans this night.  So the next night came around and we went to see him.  He was delighted.  Up onto the rooftop we go for the next views. There was so much to choose from but we decided on as couple as you can see.  With a sparkle to come with it my wife was happy.  I can't remember the names of the one we had but I can say they were great.  Service was excellent. My only negative of this night was we were sitting next tow group that were smoking Shisha and it was disgusting smell which put a dampener on the night.  Overall very happy with everything we had on this night.

Dreams Cocktail Bar is a must-visit in Lindos. The cocktails are creative and delicious, with a stunning rooftop view of the Acropolis that speaks for itself (just look at the photos!). Perfect drinks, perfect setting - the name says it all

Drinks on the rooftop

Visited the bar for drinks and was warmly welcomed by Lambis. Sat on the rooftop, amazing views of the acropolis. Music played downstairs. Quieter on the roofto...

Date of experience:¬†July 2025

places.generalDescription: Prasonisi, located at the southernmost tip of Rhodes, is a unique destination that transforms into a peninsula during the summer months. It is a haven for windsurfers and kiteboarders who flock here to take advantage of the strong Meltemi winds from June to September. The beach features twin shores - one with calm waters and the other with waves, making it ideal for water sports enthusiasts. Visitors can bring their own gear or rent equipment from local providers.

sources.snippet: To try this, you can rent a car and visit the coastal town of Prasonisi which stops at the empty beaches and covers where you can take pictures and enjoy a delicious picnic. You should also try out the non-tourist trail so that you can enjoy the fresh air and spend a lot of time with your loved ones. You will get to enjoy the beach all to yourself while you also relax in the sun and go swimming.
sources.shortName: Romantic things to do in Rhodes

sources.snippet: Rent a car and take the coastal route down to Prasonisi, stopping at empty beaches and coves on the way to capture pictures and enjoy a picnic. Taking the non-tourist trail is breath of fresh air and you‚Äôll have plenty of time alone with your loved one. Gaze at the views, relax in the sun or go for a swim.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to do in Rhodes for Couples

sources.snippet: The guide also suggests village hopping, wine tasting, sampling local honey and delicacies, taking boat trips to iconic beaches, and visiting the unique Prasonisi peninsula.
sources.shortName: 8 Unique Things To Do Beyond The Beach

sources.snippet: Alternatively, hire a car and head south on the island to remote Prasonisi, a paradise for windsurfers and kitesurfers alike.
sources.shortName: Top Things For Romantic Couples & Honeymooners To Do In Rhodes

places.name: Prasonisi

reviews.text:
Prasonisi Beach is a Paradise for all kite surfer and beach boys. There is plenty of space and the wind is pretty good.

If you are not a beach boy the beach is also really nice. You can walk to the lighthouse on the other island. We walked over at 12pm. Please wear swim clothes the water on the Sandbank is not so deep. I'm 1.90m and on the deepest point I was only under water until my hips. So you can take easily a backpack with you. Please check before if your smartphone is out of your pocket.

On the island you can use normal walking shoes. It took us round about 40mins both ways.
A fundamental stop for those visiting the island of Rhodes. A spectacle for the eyes and the soul.
An interesting place worth visiting.  The Mediterranean Sea and the Aegean Sea meet here.  Great place for water sports.
